long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
This is a modern remake of the cult classic arcade game Breakout. Breakout was released by Atari on May 13, 1976. Breakout also was a source of inspiration for the Apple II personal computer.
Click the play button arrow in the game to start the game.
If this is your first play, that will start you on the game's first level.
This game has 10 levels of increasing difficulty.
If you have played before, this will bring up the level selection screen and allow you to select any level you have played.
Your gameplay data is stored in your local web browser.
The upper left corner of the game allows you to toggle full-screen mode on or off.
The upper right corner of the game allows you to turn the sound on or off.
This game is more colorful and happier than the original it aims to emulate, it has more breakable bricks closer to the launch point, so it is pretty easy to die.

Use your mouse to move the paddle at the bottom of the screen back and forth to hit the ball upward.
Capture power-ups without allowing the ball to fall below your paddle.
Keep breaking bricks until all the breakable bricks have been destroyed.


To swipe Install this extension to play Brick game or offline with no additional downloads and no ads. 

You can contact with us support@724fun.com and share your thoughts and problems

After clicking the add the game to chrome button, you can find the game in the extensions section. If you wish, you can visit 724fun.com. If you wish, you can play again and if you want to remove it, you can remove it from the extensions section.
